segment.source: Log Files (Windows 10)
segment.target: Log Files (Windows 10)

segment.source: Log Files
segment.target: Log Files

segment.source: Log Files
segment.target: Log Files

segment.source: You can use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 logs to monitor your migration and to troubleshoot errors and failed migrations.
segment.target: You can use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 logs to monitor your migration and to troubleshoot errors and failed migrations.

segment.source: This topic describes the available command-line options to enable USMT logs, and new XML elements that configure which types of errors are fatal and should halt the migration, which types are non-fatal and should be skipped so that the migration can continue.
segment.target: This topic describes the available command-line options to enable USMT logs, and new XML elements that configure which types of errors are fatal and should halt the migration, which types are non-fatal and should be skipped so that the migration can continue.

segment.source: Log Command-Line Options
segment.target: Log Command-Line Options

segment.source: ScanState and LoadState Logs
segment.target: ScanState and LoadState Logs

segment.source: Progress Log
segment.target: Progress Log

segment.source: List Files Log
segment.target: List Files Log

segment.source: Diagnostic Log
segment.target: Diagnostic Log

segment.source: Log Command-Line Options
segment.target: Log Command-Line Options

segment.source: The following table describes each command-line option related to logs, and it provides the log name and a description of what type of information each log contains.
segment.target: The following table describes each command-line option related to logs, and it provides the log name and a description of what type of information each log contains.

segment.source: Command line Option
segment.target: Command line Option

segment.source: File Name
segment.target: File Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /l[PathFileName
segment.target: /l[PathFileName

segment.source: Scanstate.log or LoadState.log
segment.target: Scanstate.log or LoadState.log

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the ScanState.log or LoadState log.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the ScanState.log or LoadState log.

segment.source: /progress[PathFileName
segment.target: /progress[PathFileName

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the Progress log.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the Progress log.

segment.source: Provides information about the status of the migration, by percentage complete.
segment.target: Provides information about the status of the migration, by percentage complete.

segment.source: /v[VerbosityLevel]
segment.target: /v[VerbosityLevel]

segment.source: Not applicable
segment.target: Not applicable

segment.source: See the Monitoring Options section in ScanState Syntax.
segment.target: See the Monitoring Options section in ScanState Syntax.

segment.source: /listfiles[PathFileName
segment.target: /listfiles[PathFileName

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the Listfiles log.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the Listfiles log.

segment.source: Provides a list of the files that were migrated.
segment.target: Provides a list of the files that were migrated.

segment.source: Set the environment variable MIG_ENABLE_DIAG to a path to an XML file.
segment.target: Set the environment variable MIG_ENABLE_DIAG to a path to an XML file.

segment.source: USMTDiag.xml
segment.target: USMTDiag.xml

segment.source: The diagnostic log contains detailed system environment information, user environment information, and information about the migration units (migunits) being gathered and their contents.
segment.target: The diagnostic log contains detailed system environment information, user environment information, and information about the migration units (migunits) being gathered and their contents.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot store any of the log files in StorePath.
segment.target: You cannot store any of the log files in StorePath.

segment.source: If you do, the log will be overwritten when USMT is run.
segment.target: If you do, the log will be overwritten when USMT is run.

segment.source: ScanState and LoadState Logs
segment.target: ScanState and LoadState Logs

segment.source: ScanState and LoadState logs are text files that are create when you run the ScanState and LoadState tools.
segment.target: ScanState and LoadState logs are text files that are create when you run the ScanState and LoadState tools.

segment.source: You can use these logs to help monitor your migration.
segment.target: You can use these logs to help monitor your migration.

segment.source: The content of the log depends on the command-line options that you use and the verbosity level that you specify.
segment.target: The content of the log depends on the command-line options that you use and the verbosity level that you specify.

segment.source: For more information about verbosity levels, see Monitoring Options in ScanState Syntax.
segment.target: For more information about verbosity levels, see Monitoring Options in ScanState Syntax.

segment.source: Progress Log
segment.target: Progress Log

segment.source: You can create a progress log using the /progress option.
segment.target: You can create a progress log using the /progress option.

segment.source: External tools, such as Microsoft System Center Operations Manager 2007, can parse the progress log to update your monitoring systems.
segment.target: External tools, such as Microsoft System Center Operations Manager 2007, can parse the progress log to update your monitoring systems.

segment.source: The first three fields in each line are fixed as follows:
segment.target: The first three fields in each line are fixed as follows:

segment.source: Date: Date, in the format of dayshortNameOfTheMonthyear.
segment.target: Date: Date, in the format of dayshortNameOfTheMonthyear.

segment.source: For example: 08 Jun 2006.
segment.target: For example: 08 Jun 2006.

segment.source: Local time: Time, in the format of hrs:minutes:seconds (using a 24-hour clock).
segment.target: Local time: Time, in the format of hrs:minutes:seconds (using a 24-hour clock).

segment.source: For example: 13:49:13.
segment.target: For example: 13:49:13.

segment.source: Migration time: Duration of time that USMT was run, in the format of hrs:minutes:seconds.
segment.target: Migration time: Duration of time that USMT was run, in the format of hrs:minutes:seconds.

segment.source: For example: 00:00:10.
segment.target: For example: 00:00:10.

segment.source: The remaining fields are key/value pairs as indicated in the following table.
segment.target: The remaining fields are key/value pairs as indicated in the following table.

segment.source: Key
segment.target: Key

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: program
segment.target: program

segment.source: ScanState.exe or LoadState.exe.
segment.target: ScanState.exe or LoadState.exe.

segment.source: productVersion
segment.target: productVersion

segment.source: The full product version number of USMT.
segment.target: The full product version number of USMT.

segment.source: computerName
segment.target: computerName

segment.source: The name of the source or destination computer on which USMT was run.
segment.target: The name of the source or destination computer on which USMT was run.

segment.source: commandLine
segment.target: commandLine

segment.source: The full command used to run USMT.
segment.target: The full command used to run USMT.

segment.source: PHASE
segment.target: PHASE

segment.source: Reports that a new phase in the migration is starting.
segment.target: Reports that a new phase in the migration is starting.

segment.source: This can be one of the following:
segment.target: This can be one of the following:

segment.source: Initializing
segment.target: Initializing

segment.source: Scanning
segment.target: Scanning

segment.source: Collecting
segment.target: Collecting

segment.source: Saving
segment.target: Saving

segment.source: Estimating
segment.target: Estimating

segment.source: Applying
segment.target: Applying

segment.source: detectedUser
segment.target: detectedUser

segment.source: For the ScanState tool, these are the users USMT detected on the source computer that can be migrated.
segment.target: For the ScanState tool, these are the users USMT detected on the source computer that can be migrated.

segment.source: For the LoadState tool, these are the users USMT detected in the store that can be migrated.
segment.target: For the LoadState tool, these are the users USMT detected in the store that can be migrated.

segment.source: includedInMigration
segment.target: includedInMigration

segment.source: Defines whether the user profile/component is included for migration.
segment.target: Defines whether the user profile/component is included for migration.

segment.source: Valid values are Yes or No.
segment.target: Valid values are Yes or No.

segment.source: forUser
segment.target: forUser

segment.source: Specifies either of the following:
segment.target: Specifies either of the following:

segment.source: The user state being migrated.
segment.target: The user state being migrated.

segment.source: This Computer, meaning files and settings that are not associated with a user.
segment.target: This Computer, meaning files and settings that are not associated with a user.

segment.source: detectedComponent
segment.target: detectedComponent

segment.source: Specifies a component detected by USMT.
segment.target: Specifies a component detected by USMT.

segment.source: For ScanState, this is a component or application that is installed on the source computer.
segment.target: For ScanState, this is a component or application that is installed on the source computer.

segment.source: For LoadState, this is a component or application that was detected in the store.
segment.target: For LoadState, this is a component or application that was detected in the store.

segment.source: totalSizeInMBToTransfer
segment.target: totalSizeInMBToTransfer

segment.source: Total size of the files and settings to migrate in megabytes (MB).
segment.target: Total size of the files and settings to migrate in megabytes (MB).

segment.source: totalPercentageCompleted
segment.target: totalPercentageCompleted

segment.source: Total percentage of the migration that has been completed by either ScanState or LoadState.
segment.target: Total percentage of the migration that has been completed by either ScanState or LoadState.

segment.source: collectingUser
segment.target: collectingUser

segment.source: Specifies which user ScanState is collecting files and settings for.
segment.target: Specifies which user ScanState is collecting files and settings for.

segment.source: totalMinutesRemaining
segment.target: totalMinutesRemaining

segment.source: Time estimate, in minutes, for the migration to complete.
segment.target: Time estimate, in minutes, for the migration to complete.

segment.source: error
segment.target: error

segment.source: Type of non-fatal error that occurred.
segment.target: Type of non-fatal error that occurred.

segment.source: This can be one of the following:
segment.target: This can be one of the following:

segment.source: UnableToCopy: Unable to copy to store because the disk on which the store is located is full.
segment.target: UnableToCopy: Unable to copy to store because the disk on which the store is located is full.

segment.source: UnableToOpen: Unable to open the file for migration because the file is opened in non-shared mode by another application or service.
segment.target: UnableToOpen: Unable to open the file for migration because the file is opened in non-shared mode by another application or service.

segment.source: UnableToCopyCatalog: Unable to copy because the store is corrupted.
segment.target: UnableToCopyCatalog: Unable to copy because the store is corrupted.

segment.source: UnableToAccessDevice: Unable to access the device.
segment.target: UnableToAccessDevice: Unable to access the device.

segment.source: UnableToApply: Unable to apply the setting to the destination computer.
segment.target: UnableToApply: Unable to apply the setting to the destination computer.

segment.source: objectName
segment.target: objectName

segment.source: The name of the file or setting that caused the non-fatal error.
segment.target: The name of the file or setting that caused the non-fatal error.

segment.source: action
segment.target: action

segment.source: Action taken by USMT for the non-fatal error.
segment.target: Action taken by USMT for the non-fatal error.

segment.source: The values are:
segment.target: The values are:

segment.source: Ignore: Non-fatal error ignored and the migration continued because the /c option was specified on the command line.
segment.target: Ignore: Non-fatal error ignored and the migration continued because the /c option was specified on the command line.

segment.source: Abort: Stopped the migration because the /c option was not specified.
segment.target: Abort: Stopped the migration because the /c option was not specified.

segment.source: errorCode
segment.target: errorCode

segment.source: The errorCode or return value.
segment.target: The errorCode or return value.

segment.source: numberOfIgnoredErrors
segment.target: numberOfIgnoredErrors

segment.source: The total number of non-fatal errors that USMT ignored.
segment.target: The total number of non-fatal errors that USMT ignored.

segment.source: message
segment.target: message

segment.source: The message corresponding to the errorCode.
segment.target: The message corresponding to the errorCode.

segment.source: List Files Log
segment.target: List Files Log

segment.source: The List files log (Listfiles.txt) provides a list of the files that were migrated.
segment.target: The List files log (Listfiles.txt) provides a list of the files that were migrated.

segment.source: This list can be used to troubleshoot XML issues or can be retained as a record of the files that were gathered into the migration store.
segment.target: This list can be used to troubleshoot XML issues or can be retained as a record of the files that were gathered into the migration store.

segment.source: The List Files log is only available for ScanState.exe.
segment.target: The List Files log is only available for ScanState.exe.

segment.source: Diagnostic Log
segment.target: Diagnostic Log

segment.source: You can obtain the diagnostic log by setting the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG to a path to an XML file.
segment.target: You can obtain the diagnostic log by setting the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG to a path to an XML file.

segment.source: The diagnostic log contains:
segment.target: The diagnostic log contains:

segment.source: Detailed system environment information
segment.target: Detailed system environment information

segment.source: Detailed user environment information
segment.target: Detailed user environment information

segment.source: Information about the migration units (migunits) being gathered and their contents
segment.target: Information about the migration units (migunits) being gathered and their contents

segment.source: Using the Diagnostic Log
segment.target: Using the Diagnostic Log

segment.source: The diagnostic log is essentially a report of all the migration units (migunits) included in the migration.
segment.target: The diagnostic log is essentially a report of all the migration units (migunits) included in the migration.

segment.source: A migunit is a collection of data that is identified by the component it is associated with in the XML files.
segment.target: A migunit is a collection of data that is identified by the component it is associated with in the XML files.

segment.source: The migration store is made up of all the migunits in the migration.
segment.target: The migration store is made up of all the migunits in the migration.

segment.source: The diagnostic log can be used to verify which migunits were included in the migration and can be used for troubleshooting while authoring migration XML files.
segment.target: The diagnostic log can be used to verify which migunits were included in the migration and can be used for troubleshooting while authoring migration XML files.

segment.source: The following examples describe common scenarios in which you can use the diagnostic log.
segment.target: The following examples describe common scenarios in which you can use the diagnostic log.

segment.source: Why is this file not migrating when I authored an "include" rule for it?
segment.target: Why is this file not migrating when I authored an "include" rule for it?

segment.source: Let’s imagine that we have the following directory structure and that we want the “data” directory to be included in the migration along with the “New Text Document.txt” file in the “New Folder.”
segment.target: Let’s imagine that we have the following directory structure and that we want the “data” directory to be included in the migration along with the “New Text Document.txt” file in the “New Folder.”

segment.source: The directory of C:data contains:
segment.target: The directory of C:data contains:

segment.source: The directory of C:dataNew Folder contains:
segment.target: The directory of C:dataNew Folder contains:

segment.source: To migrate these files you author the following migration XML:
segment.target: To migrate these files you author the following migration XML:

segment.source: However, upon testing the migration you notice that the “New Text Document.txt” file isn’t included in the migration.
segment.target: However, upon testing the migration you notice that the “New Text Document.txt” file isn’t included in the migration.

segment.source: To troubleshoot this failure, the migration can be repeated with the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG set such that the diagnostic log is generated.
segment.target: To troubleshoot this failure, the migration can be repeated with the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG set such that the diagnostic log is generated.

segment.source: Upon searching the diagnostic log for the component “DATA1”, the following XML section is discovered:
segment.target: Upon searching the diagnostic log for the component “DATA1”, the following XML section is discovered:

segment.source: Analysis of this XML section reveals the migunit that was created when the migration rule was processed.
segment.target: Analysis of this XML section reveals the migunit that was created when the migration rule was processed.

segment.source: The Perform section details the actual files that were scheduled for gathering and the result of the gathering operation.
segment.target: The Perform section details the actual files that were scheduled for gathering and the result of the gathering operation.

segment.source: The “New Text Document.txt” file doesn’t appear in this section, which confirms that the migration rule was not correctly authored.
segment.target: The “New Text Document.txt” file doesn’t appear in this section, which confirms that the migration rule was not correctly authored.

segment.source: An analysis of the XML elements reference topic reveals that the pattern tag needs to be modified as follows:
segment.target: An analysis of the XML elements reference topic reveals that the pattern tag needs to be modified as follows:

segment.source: When the migration is preformed again with the modified tag, the diagnostic log reveals the following:
segment.target: When the migration is preformed again with the modified tag, the diagnostic log reveals the following:

segment.source: This diagnostic log confirms that the modified pattern value enables the migration of the file.
segment.target: This diagnostic log confirms that the modified pattern value enables the migration of the file.

segment.source: Why is this file migrating when I authored an exclude rule excluding it?
segment.target: Why is this file migrating when I authored an exclude rule excluding it?

segment.source: In this scenario, you have the following directory structure and you want all files in the “data” directory to migrate, except for text files.
segment.target: In this scenario, you have the following directory structure and you want all files in the “data” directory to migrate, except for text files.

segment.source: The C:Data folder contains:
segment.target: The C:Data folder contains:

segment.source: The C:DataNew Folder contains:
segment.target: The C:DataNew Folder contains:

segment.source: You author the following migration XML:
segment.target: You author the following migration XML:

segment.source: However, upon testing the migration you notice that all the text files are still included in the migration.
segment.target: However, upon testing the migration you notice that all the text files are still included in the migration.

segment.source: In order to troubleshoot this issue, the migration can be performed with the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG set so that the diagnostic log is generated.
segment.target: In order to troubleshoot this issue, the migration can be performed with the environment variable MIGENABLEDIAG set so that the diagnostic log is generated.

segment.source: Upon searching the diagnostic log for the component “DATA1”, the following XML section is discovered:
segment.target: Upon searching the diagnostic log for the component “DATA1”, the following XML section is discovered:

segment.source: Upon reviewing the diagnostic log, you confirm that the files are still migrating, and that it is a problem with the authored migration XML rule.
segment.target: Upon reviewing the diagnostic log, you confirm that the files are still migrating, and that it is a problem with the authored migration XML rule.

segment.source: You author an update to the migration XML script as follows:
segment.target: You author an update to the migration XML script as follows:

segment.source: Your revised migration XML script excludes the files from migrating, as confirmed in the diagnostic log:
segment.target: Your revised migration XML script excludes the files from migrating, as confirmed in the diagnostic log:
